Articles.Content:
I find that whenever a new version comes out, I always tend to keep my copy of the old version. Not that I am planning on actually playing the old version, just, you know, to have it. So, since I've been playing KSP since .18, that means I have a lot of the old versions laying around. Using similar collecting logic, I tend to also get all three platforms whenever a new version comes out. 

All together, this means I have: 0.18.4 (W), 0.19.1 (W), 0.21.1 (W), 0.22.0 (L), 0.23.0 (W), 0.23.5 (W), 0.24.2 (W,M,L), 0.25.0 (W), 0.90.0 (W,M,L), 1.0.2 (w), 1.0.4 (W,M,L). 

The only one missing entirely is .20, and .22 is present in Linux flavor but not Windows. I usually wait around a while to download new versions so I usually end up with the last hotfix of a major version. 

Anybody else keep around their old versions? Anybody got a collection bigger than mine?

I keep old versions too. I think that if I want to play or need them, but there have not been many cases in couple of years. However, they do not take anything, 1-2 GB hard disk costs couple of cents.

I have 0.18.2, 0.19.0, 0.19.1, 0.20.0, 0.20.2, 0.21.1, 0.22.0, 0.23.0, 0.23.5, 0.24.0, 0.24.2, 0.25.0, 0.90.0, 1.0.0, 1.0.2 and 1.0.4 for 32 bit Windows, 0.24.0 and 0.24.2 for 64 bit windows and 0.90.0 and 1.0.2 for Linux. I have also all versions of all mods I have used and text files to tell which versions work together.

I have alan turing's computer and every version of ksp past, present & future.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-08-06T16:56:56Z" title="08/06/2015 04:56  PM" data-short="8 yr">August 6, 2015</time> by Violent Jeb**
  
to further articulate my superiority
I have a several major releases. I missed some of the hotfix patches. I figure it's like the stuff on my old ipod; I thought I would be traumatized if I lost them but I never use them anyways...
I've managed to collect all the way back to 0.7.3. The game sure has come along a bit since then..
I saw a screenshot of an ancient version of KSP that had bright blue water in the oceans, anywhere I can download a copy of that from Squad?
Not from Squad, no, but nearly all the versions from 0.13.3 and earlier are **available and free to share.**

@sal\_vager

Wow, I didn't know there was a repository of all the old versions. I remember playing the last free versions with C7 Aerospace parts! Fun fact - there was no wheeled landing gear yet, only skids.

I have 0.7.3 and 0.13.3 

download zip with two of these versions here: [https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ckw3_4cu2lLFVQibAJnKAXoRG5Ddm-tI/view?usp=sharing](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1Ckw3_4cu2lLFVQibAJnKAXoRG5Ddm-tI/view?usp=sharing)

![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")
